text: Hey Ashleigh! We are investigating supporting something similar to what I think you are describing, talk to me about your use case.
Is it possible to redirect using HUBL (akin to redirecting with headers in PHP)? E.g. if a query string doesn't match a certain value, redirect user to different page
You’ll want to use JS for that so you can keep the pages cached
Well, we are trying to hide content from people who don't have a correct hash in the query string... if they have js disabled that won't work

I was successful doing this on a custom template where I suppressed the content on the page and inserted js to redirect. However we're trying to apply this to a drag and drop template now, and wondering if there is a way to do this without either converting the template to a custom html+hubl or inserting the hubl code into every sensitive content module on the page.
I was thinking if I was able to use HUBL to redirect I could just create an authentication module at the top of the template and make that redirect server-side.
well I have content that I want the user to be able to rearrange in a flex column and wanted to use a template partial to keep the code clean
I’ve done this in the past by using includes to include other templates into the page
basically having a “routing” coded file that the page the user lands on is actually using, and in that file it’s including another template based on if the visitor has said query parameter in url
as Matt stated this should not be used  heavily as it breaks caching
Hiding the data complicates things
How sensitive is the data that you need to hide?
Not personal data sensitive but its a blog we're including some proprietary information in.
Been looking into it and I think I can do something like what Jon was suggesting.  Thank you both for your help!
Content Membership is best on the off chance you have enterprise

when creating an html/ hubl template, how do I preload content into the flex column section of my html hubl template? inside of my widget_container I have several widget_blocks and they are not showing up in the default for the template.
Makes sense. What lives within the partial? Is it a series of modules?
Hi, anyone know how I can make a variable global and update the same?
on a template level yes
Hi, I need set a value to variable $list_name inner loop and use the variable outside the loop, any idea?
